Federal Guidance Updates

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Department of Energy
    Biden-Harris Administration Announces $180 Million Investment in School Energy Infrastructure as Part of Investing in America Agenda published Mar 20, 2024

    On March 20th, the DOE opened applications for the 2024 Renew America's Schools Prize, which will award $180 million to districts across the country engaging in strategic partnerships to build capacity and implement energy upgrades at K-12 schools, lowering energy use and costs, improving indoor air quality, and fostering healthier learning environments.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
    Biden-Harris Administration announces $24 million in pollution prevention grants under Presidentâ€™s Investing in America agenda published Mar 18, 2024

    On March 18th, the EPA announced the availability of nearly $24 million in grants to support states, U.S. territories, and Tribes in providing technical assistance to businesses to develop and adopt pollution prevention practices.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT)
    USDOT Announces $450 Million For Ports Available Through the Port Infrastructure Development Programâ€¯ published Mar 12, 2024

    On March 12th, USDOTâ€™s Maritime Administration (MARAD) published a Notice of Funding Opportunity (NOFO) for $450 million in Federal Fiscal Year 2024 funding through MARADâ€™s Port Infrastructure Development Program (PIDP).

  • Category of Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) Agency U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT)
    Biden-Harris Administration Opens Applications for $1.2 Billion in Funding to Decrease Air Pollution from the Transportation Sector as Part of Investing in America Agenda published Mar 12, 2024

    On March 12th, the Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) launched the Low Carbon Transportation Materials Program, making $1.2 billion in funding available to lower air pollution, specifically greenhouse gas emissions (GHG), through reimbursement and incentive funding for low carbon construction materials and products used in transportation.

  • Category of Bipartisan Infrastructure Law (BIL) Agency Department of Energy
    Biden-Harris Administration Announces $425 Million to Decarbonize and Manufacture Clean Energy Products in Former Coal Communities as Part of Investing in America Agenda published Mar 08, 2024

    On March 8th, DOE announced the availability of $425 million in funding to reduce industrial emissions and advance clean energy manufacturing essential to the U.S. energy supply chain.
